name: Slovakia
description: Slovakia, a landlocked country in Central Europe, boasts a diverse landscape ranging from the High Tatras mountains to the rolling plains of the Great Hungarian Plain. Known for its rich history, medieval castles, charming towns, and burgeoning outdoor recreation opportunities, Slovakia offers a unique blend of culture and natural beauty. It’s a relatively undiscovered gem, offering authentic experiences and stunning scenery.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The vibrant capital city of Slovakia, situated on the Danube River.
quickFacts.detail: Bratislava is known for its historic Old Town, stunning architecture, and lively cultural scene.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Slovakia has a relatively small but welcoming population.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is around 106 people per square kilometer.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Slovakia is a compact country with a varied terrain.
quickFacts.detail: It's roughly the size of Indiana, USA.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The Slovak language is a West Slavic language.
quickFacts.detail: Hungarian is also widely spoken, particularly in northern Slovakia.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The national currency previously was the Slovak Koruna.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: It's a member of the European Union and NATO.

climateData.title: Climate of Slovakia
climateData.description: Slovakia experiences a temperate continental climate with four distinct seasons. Summers are warm and sunny, while winters are cold and snowy, particularly in the mountainous regions. Rainfall is evenly distributed throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, with wildflowers blooming across the countryside and snow melting from the mountains.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is the warmest season, with average temperatures ranging from 20°C to 28°C (68°F to 82°F). It's ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures and vibrant fall foliage. It's a beautiful time for hiking and exploring.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is cold and snowy, with average temperatures ranging from -2°C to 4°C (28°F to 39°F).  The High Tatras mountains offer excellent skiing opportunities.

naturalWonders.name: High Tatras Mountains
naturalWonders.description: The High Tatras are Slovakia's highest mountain range, offering breathtaking views, challenging hiking trails, and pristine alpine lakes. They are a haven for outdoor enthusiasts and nature lovers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The highest peak, Gerlachovský štít, reaches 2,655 meters (8,711 feet). Numerous glacial lakes, such as Štrbské Pleso and Popradské Pleso, add to the area's dramatic beauty.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before heading out

naturalWonders.name: Slovak Karst
naturalWonders.description: The Slovak Karst is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, renowned for its extensive cave systems, sinkholes, and unique limestone formations. It's a fascinating geological area with a rich history of speleology.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Kremnica Cave is one of the largest caves in Slovakia, featuring impressive stalactites and stalagmites. The area also boasts numerous smaller caves and underground rivers.

naturalWonders.name: Danube River
naturalWonders.description: The Danube River flows through Slovakia, forming a significant portion of its border with Hungary and Romania. It's a vital waterway and a popular destination for river cruises.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The river offers scenic views, opportunities for boating and fishing, and access to charming riverside towns and villages.
viewingTips: Enjoy a picnic by the river

biodiversityCategory.name: Forests
biodiversityCategory.description: Slovakia's forests cover approximately 45% of the country's land area, providing habitat for a diverse range of plant and animal species. They play a crucial role in carbon sequestration and water regulation.

statistics.details: Common species include beech, spruce, fir, and oak.
Significant portions are managed for timber production and conservation.

notableSpecies.name: European Roe Deer
notableSpecies.significance: A common and important herbivore in Slovak forests.

notableSpecies.name: Eurasian Lynx
notableSpecies.significance: A rare and elusive predator found in the mountainous regions.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Slovakia
ecosystemData.overview: Slovakia's ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from alpine meadows to lowland forests and wetlands. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, contributing significantly to the country's biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Alpine Meadows
biodiversityCategories.description: High-altitude meadows characterized by unique plant species adapted to harsh conditions.

statistics.details: Many endemic and rare alpine plants.

biodiversityCategories.name: Temperate Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Dominated by deciduous trees, these forests provide habitat for a wide range of wildlife.

statistics.details: Beech, oak, and spruce are the most common species.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Slovakia
activities.description: Slovakia offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and cycling to skiing and water sports.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Slovakia's stunning mountain landscapes and forests on foot.

activities.name: High Tatras Hiking
activities.description: Hike to mountain huts and enjoy breathtaking views.

activities.name: Slovak Karst Hiking
activities.description: Explore the unique limestone formations and cave systems.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy swimming, kayaking, and rafting on Slovakia's rivers and lakes.

activities.name: Danube River Rafting
activities.description: Raft down the scenic Danube River.

activities.name: Lake Štrbské Pleso Swimming
activities.description: Swim in the crystal-clear waters of Lake Štrbské Pleso.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, hat, gloves
